theoryTitle: The Calm Belt Introduction Was Strategic Foreshadowing
theoryText: Some fans theorize that introducing the Calm Belt in this filler arc was a deliberate decision by the anime production team to foreshadow its importance later in the series. By introducing it earlier than the manga (where it appears at Reverse Mountain), the anime subtly plants the concept in viewers' minds before it becomes crucial to the plot.
author: One Piece Fan Community
statusExplanation: The Calm Belt does indeed become very important later in the series, particularly in relation to Amazon Lily, Impel Down, and Marine navigation. The anime's early introduction successfully familiarized viewers with the concept.

theoryTitle: Warship Island Arc Was Created to Avoid Loguetown Pacing Issues
theoryText: Fans have theorized that the Warship Island Arc was created as a buffer to prevent the anime from catching up to the manga too quickly after the emotionally intense Arlong Park Arc and before the important Loguetown Arc. This would give the manga time to progress while keeping anime viewers engaged.
author: One Piece Production Analysis Community
statusExplanation: This is a common reason for filler arcs in long-running anime adaptations. The timing between Arlong Park and Loguetown would have made pacing difficult without some padding content.

theoryTitle: The Hiso Hiso no Mi Could Have Been Useful for the Crew
theoryText: Some fans discuss how the Hiso Hiso no Mi (Whisper-Whisper Fruit) would have been extremely useful for the Straw Hat crew, particularly for gathering intelligence from animals and birds. This has led to discussions about why Oda didn't include a similar canon ability for one of the crew members.
author: One Piece Ability Discussion Community
statusExplanation: While the ability would be useful, Oda has created other ways for the crew to gather information. The power may have been too convenient for the story he wanted to tell.
